intro: Linkia angulata, commonly known as the angular linkia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often angular in shape, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
